topic.title: Reusing DITA Topics in Multiple Maps

keywords.indexterm: DITAReusing contentReference Topics in multiple maps

body.p: You can reuse an entire DITA topic simply by referencing it in multiple maps (or multiple locations within the same map) using one of the following procedures:

section.title: Reuse Topics Using the DITA Maps Manager

ol.li: Make sure the DITA map is opened in the DITA Maps Manager.

Add a reference to an existing topic by using one of the following methods (depending on your particular situation):
If the topic already exists in this DITA map, do one of the following:
Simply drag the topic and press Ctrl (or Alt on OS X) at the new location within the map (or use the Copy and Paste contextual menu actions).
If the topic already exists in another DITA map, do one of the following:
Open the other map in the DITA Maps Manager, right-click the topic, select Copy, switch back to the original DITA map in the DITA Maps Manager, determine the new location in the map, right-click a parent or sibling topic, and use one of the Paste contextual menu actions (Paste, Paste Before, or Paste After).
If the topic exists in the project, but has not yet been added to a DITA map, do one of the following:
Right-click the topic in the ProjectNavigator view (or the file system), select Copy, switch to the DITA Maps Manager view, determine the new location in the map, right-click a parent or sibling topic, and use one of the Paste contextual menu actions (Paste, Paste Before, or Paste After).

section.title: Reuse Topics Using Author Mode Editor

ol.li: Open the DITA map in the Author mode editor.

Add a reference to an existing topic by dragging it from the ProjectNavigator view (or the file system) and dropping it in the desired location in the DITA map opened in Author mode. You can also accomplish the same thing by using the Copy and Paste contextual menu actions.

section.title: Displaying Multiple References to the Same Topics
section.p: Whenever multiple references to the same topic are detected in the context of the current map in the DITA Maps Manager, an indicator will appear in the top-right corner of the Author mode editor that shows the number of times the current topic is referenced in the DITA map. It also includes navigation arrows that allow you to jump to the next or previous reference in the DITA Maps Manager.
